title: Ranil’s arrest a launching pad for major alliance
byline: The opposition parties – the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), United National Party (UNP), Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) and the People’s Alliance (PA) etc – that came together in the wake of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s arrest have decided to forge ahead in unity, with the aim of forming an electoral alliance overcoming internal challenges and competing interests in the future, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Suspect arrested over attack on Policeman near court
byline: A former Urban Councillor has been arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) in connection with an attack on a police officer on duty near the Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: Health Ministry warns against using whitening toothpaste
byline: The Health Ministry has advised people to stop using whitening toothpaste, saying it does not make teeth truly white.

title: ICFS to host UK study abroad open day on August 30
byline: ICFS will host a UK Study Abroad Open Day on Friday, August 30, 2025, from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. at its head office in Nugegoda. The event is tailored for Sri Lankan students aspiring to pursue higher education in the United Kingdom, offering an affordable and accessible route to their academic ambitions.

title: Condom use to be included in school curriculum
byline: The Ministry of Health’s National STD/AIDS Control Programme has recommended integrating HIV/STI prevention measures—including condom use, Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP), and Post-Exposure Prophylaxis (PEP)—into Sri Lanka’s school curriculum.

title: Kim Jong Un to join Putin and other leaders at China military parade
byline: North Korea’s leader Kim Jong Un will attend a military parade in Beijing next week, China’s foreign ministry has said - in what is believed to be his first international level meeting of leaders.

title: CID, Interpol arrest Sri Lankan gang in Indonesia
byline: Five members of a major Sri Lankan criminal gang including Kehelbaddara Padme and Commando Salintha have been arrested by Indonesian security forces, Police said.

title: Man shot dead in Panadura, Police suspect underworld conflict
byline: A 55-year-old man was shot dead in the Alubogahawatta area of Panadura last night (27), police said.

title: Five arrested for running brothel disguised as spa in Mirihana
byline: Five individuals, including three women, were arrested last evening for allegedly running a brothel under the guise of a spa in Embuldeniya, along Stanley Thilakaratne Mawatha, within the Mirihana police area, police said.

title: Thusitha Halloluwa further remanded
byline: Former Director of the National Lotteries Board, Thusitha Halloluwa was today further remanded till September 4 in connection with the incident of assault and shooting at his vehicle.

title: Air Force warns against flying kites in the vicinity of airport runways
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) warned the public against flying kites in the vicinity of airport runways as it poses a serious safety hazard.

title: Australian lawmaker Bob Katter threatens journalist with fist at press conference
byline: A veteran Australian lawmaker threatened a television journalist at a press conference on immigration on Thursday, shaking his fist and saying he had previously punched people for mentioning his Lebanese heritage.

title: Five arrested for killing pregnant spotted deer in Wilpattu National Park
byline: Five suspects were arrested yesterday (28) for hunting a pregnant spotted deer in Wilpattu National Park, the Wildlife Department said.

title: Over 5,000 eye donations recorded this year: SLEDS
byline: The Sri Lanka Eye Donation Society (SLEDS) has reported that 5,117 eye donations were recorded posthumously during the first eight months of this year.

title: Deputy Minister condemns SLTB union action, strike linked to Namal
byline: Transport and Highways Deputy Minister Dr. Prasanna Gunasena strongly condemned the trade union action launched by Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) employees, claiming that it was initiated following discussions with Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa.

title: Irony strikes Ranil as he was remanded in prison standing on his ancestral land - Wajira
byline: United National Party (UNP) Chairman Wajira Abeywardena said that the 43-acre land on which the Welikada Prison now stands once belonged to the ancestral family of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Sri Lanka names T20I squad for Zimbabwe tour
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket has announced a 17-member squad for the upcoming T20 International (T20I) series against Zimbabwe. The squad was approved by the national selection panel and will be led by Charith Asalanka, who takes on the captaincy role for the series.

title: Rugby further strangled
byline: The administration of rugby hit further turmoil yesterday when an election of office=bearers to run its affairs was postponed.

title: Misled by Google Maps, 3 men die after driving their car off incomplete bridge in India
byline: Three men were killed after their car drove off an incomplete bridge and plunged on a riverbed while they were using Google Maps to navigate in Uttar Pradesh, India, in the early hours of Nov 24.

title: Europeans to initiate UN sanctions process on Iran, diplomats say
byline: Britain, France and Germany will begin the process of reimposing U.N. sanctions on Iran at the U.N. Security Council on Thursday, two European diplomats said.

title: ’’Ranil’s lawyers ended his political future’’ – Lalkantha
byline: The reasons given by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s lawyers during court proceedings for his bail have ended his political future, Agriculture Minister K. D. Lalkantha said.

title: Kuliyapitiya school van accident: Deputy Minister visits Kurunegala hospital
byline: Women and Child Affairs Deputy Minister Dr. Namal Sudarshana today visited the Kurunegala Teaching Hospital to check on the condition of children injured in the tragic Kuliyapitiya school van accident.

title: Youth accused of brutally attacking dog in Nanuoya
byline: A complaint has been lodged with the Nanuoya Police against a youth accused of beating a dog with a club, smashing it on the ground, and throwing it into a canal.

title: Posts on Harini visiting Ranil in hospital: CID seeks court permission to examine CCTV
byline: The Maligakanda magistrate informed the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) that permission can be granted to examine CCTV footages of the National Hospital, Colombo if needed in the investigation into the social media posts which claimed that Prime Minister Harirni Amarasuriya visited former President Ranil Wickremesinghe in the hospital.

title: Criminals fled country after losing political support: IGP
byline: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasuriya revealed that organised crime in Sri Lanka had previously thrived due to political backing, but the dismantling of such support networks has driven many criminals out of the country.

title: Special high courts, new laws to expedite crime cases: Minister
byline: Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said that the government is planning to establish special courts to expedite trials against organised criminals, in response to long delays and rising costs in the judicial process.

title: Govt to introduce fingerprint scanners in all state institutions
byline: The Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government Ministry announced that steps will be taken to install fingerprint scanners in all government institutions that do not currently have them.

title: Sri Lanka to repatriate underworld suspects arrested in Indonesia
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala said today that steps are being taken to repatriate a group of wanted underworld suspects, including notorious figure Kehelbaddara Padme, who were arrested in Indonesia.

title: Sajith requests tariff relief in talks with U.S. democracy partnership
byline: Opposition Leader Premadasa today (27) met with a delegation from the United States House Democracy Partnership (HDP) at Parliament, with U.S. Ambassador Julie Chung also present.

title: Presidential Secretariat denies RTI request on President’s travel details
byline: The Presidential Secretariat has declined to release information on the domestic travel of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in response to a Right to Information (RTI) request.

title: Tourist pouring beer down elephant’s trunk in Kenya sparks anger
byline: Several investigations have been launched after a Spanish man in Kenya posted videos of himself pouring beer down an elephant’s trunk - sparking anger on social media.

title: Eight-day marine weather forecast issued for coastal areas
byline: The Marine Weather Division of the Meteorology Department today issued an eight-day forecast for coastal areas around the country.

title: Two arrested for killing deer in Nanu Oya
byline: Two individuals were arrested yesterday in connection with the killing of a deer in the Nanu Oya area of Nuwara Eliya, the Wildlife Department said.

title: Public warned over fake banking websites
byline: Local banks have urged customers to remain vigilant as scammers circulate fraudulent links via emails and text messages, directing users to fake banking websites designed to steal personal and financial information.

title: 108 couples married at one ceremony
byline: A group of 108 young couples in Jaffna entered into the happy union of marriage at a mass wedding ceremony yesterday at the Selva Sannithi Murugan Temple in Jaffna.

title: Former Urban Councillor remanded till Sept 8 over attack on policeman
byline: A former Urban Councillor, who was arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) in connection with an attack on a police officer near the Fort Magistrate’s Court, was today ordered to be remanded until September 8.

title: Sri Lanka names squad for Asia Cup
byline: The Sri Lanka Cricket Selection Panel has announced the 16-member national squad for the upcoming ACC Men’s T20 Asia Cup 2025, which will be played in the United Arab Emirates from September 9 to 28.

title: Ven Narampanawe Ananda Thera elected as Anunayake of Asgiri Chapter
byline: The Deputy Registrar of the Asgiri Chapter, Most Venerable Narampanawe Ananda Thera, was today (28) elected as the Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siyam Maha Nikaya.

title: Approval must for UNPers to participate in  media talk shows
byline: UNPers will not be allowed to participate in media talk shows without the approval of party General Secretary Thalatha Athukorala, an official statement said today.

title: Probe underway to identify organisers of Ranil protest: IGP
byline: The Inspector General of Police (IGP) said today that investigations are underway to identify individuals who organised the protest outside the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court when former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s case was taken up.

title: Daily Mirror Brief: Daily News Recap, Top Headlines & Must-Read Stories - 28th August
byline: Daily Mirror Brief is your daily news digest—bringing you the top headlines, key updates, and essential stories you may have missed across politics, tech, culture, and global affairs. Quick, clear, and curated—your trusted news recap, whenever you’re ready.

title: Sun directly over Sri Lanka for 10 days
byline: The sun is expected to be directly over Sri Lanka from today (28) to September 7, as a result of its apparent southward relative motion, the Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre said.
